name: constraint
content:

C2 [ C ] something that controls what you do by keeping you within particular limits: The constraints of politeness wouldn't allow her to say what she really thought about his cooking. Financial constraints on the company are preventing them from employing new staff. Synonyms
check (LIMIT)
control (POWER)
curb (CONTROL)
curtailment
limit
limitation
restraint
restriction
[ U ] formal unnatural behaviour that is sometimes the result of forcing yourself to act in a particular way: She tried to appear friendly, but her constraint was obvious. under constraint formal
If you do something under constraint, you do it only because you have been forced to: They confessed, but only under severe constraint.
